name: stultified
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
past simple and past participle of
stultify
to prevent something from developing, or prevent someone from developing new ideas: She felt the repetitive exercises stultified her musical technique so she stopped doing them. The new set of measures could stultify the industry. See
stultifying
More examplesFewer examplesHe feared that the job would stultify his creativity forever.The mention of her name appeared to stultify him.The regulations stultify the freedom of workers.
